text: today I'm gonna make a fantastic black
bean soup and I'm starting with dried
black beans this is a pound of black
beans put them into a pot or into a ball
so just cover them with cold water by
about two inches and then you
refrigerate these overnight so here I
have some beans that I've soaked
overnight you want to drain these and
cook them in fresh water they've
expanded quite a bit the soaking may
seem like something that you don't
really need to do but it actually helps
the beans cook more evenly as well as
speeding up the cooking process you can
do a speeded-up version of this by
covering your beans with water bringing
it to a boil
turning it off and letting it sit at
room temperature for an hour to cook the
beans and add some flavor I'm gonna add
some onion and some jalapeno I'm cutting
up two large onions already everyone
done mince them cooking beans is a
really great thing to do especially if
you have a little bit of time on the
weekends because you can freeze them if
you do a double recipe and keep lots in
your freezer you can always make soups
tacos lots of different things that
require beans these onions were extra
extra large so I'm only gonna use one
and a half you need two large onions
total as well as two jalapenos so over
here I'm gonna cook my beans in this pot
I'm gonna add first a quarter of those
onions so about a half of an onion and a
quarter of the jalapenos as well so a
half of a jalapeno then cover your beans
with water by about two inches now most
people don't season their beans before
they cook them but I do because I think
it adds flavor and I don't find in any
way that it affects the texture you want
to bring this to a boil and then reduce
it to a simmer and cook until all the
beans are tender that'll take about 50
minutes when the beans are tender some
of the liquid will have absorbed and now
you can make your soup but you can also
just take the
beans and use them for whatever you want
obviously you don't have to make the
means to make the soup you can start
with canned beans if you come on you
guys
I'm just teasin add about a tablespoon
of olive oil to your pot add the
remaining onions that's one and a half
onions and the remaining jalapeno as
well as four cloves of garlic that have
also been menaced you want to cook your
onions and garlic and jalapeno it to
pull out some of the flavor and let them
get translucent a little bit softer add
two teaspoons of cumin and fry that out
a little bit then add one in 3/4 cups of
vegetable broth or chicken broth if
you're not a vegetarian and then the
remaining beans and their liquid so you
want to simmer this soup you can season
it to a little bit just turn it down now
that it's come to a boil and then
partially cover it and cook it for about
20 minutes when your soup has simmered
for 20 minutes you're gonna want to
puree some of it it's not so soup like
yet so take about 2 cups out and puree
it with a tablespoon of cornstarch then
you add your 1 tablespoon of cornstarch
directly to the blender and blend that
all together the cornstarch is gonna
thicken the soup add pureed back
you're cognizant then you can add your
suit back to the pot and the cornstarch
needs to simmer to thicken so bring it
back to a simmer and the cornstarch just
adds a tiny hint of thickening power it
makes it a little bit more silky one
last thing before you serve it up season
it with some lime juice you can serve
lime wedges on the side or you can just
squeeze about two tablespoons of lime
juice directly into your soup and I'm
noticing that I'm adding this lime juice
and it's making it a little bit pink the
acidity is changing the color and that's
it black bean soup is ready to serve
and of course I want to garnish it with
lots of stuff because that's what makes
it over-the-top fantastic so a little
bit of avocado a little bit of yogurt
please Greek yogurt is good cuz it's
very thick adds a nice tang and then
maybe some tortillas you can buy corn
chips whatever you want you can make
your own corn tortilla strips I am super
excited to have this on my table and in
my freezer tonight and you're gonna be
excited too
